raw_comment:
I notice that the percent of people who contact each other in person is so drastically smaller than the percentage of people who just text each other.  This makes me wonder if the reason for this is that we have the opportunity to just see them on social media and update ourselves on their lives by their post so why talk to them. This relates to my community because I think that we are a pretty outgoing community but even in my own home I see the distance between my friends and our parents due to our phones and texting. 
Title being… “texting vs. humanity”
ace_sentences: The percent of people who contact each other in person is drastically smaller than the percent of people who text each other.
I wonder about a reason for this fact.
People have an opportunity to see other people on social media.
People can update themselves about the lives of other people by posts on social media.
This opportunity may reduce the need to talk to other people in person.
This fact relates to my community.
I think that my community is outgoing.
Even in my home, I see a distance between my friends and our parents.
This distance is due to phones and texting.
The title is: texting vs. humanity.
